data.fullContent: To help stop the conversion of farmland into neighborhoods, businesses, and landfills, some states in the United States have passed laws that give land owners higher prices for their farmland if they do not use it to build houses, office parks, shopping centers, industrial complexes, and other buildings. The new rules are called agricultural rent control and are also known as farmland preservation programs. These programs are intended to create more farmland by increasing the prices farmers receive for the land they sell. Many farming communities have also adopted local ordinances that give farmers the right to have a preference when their neighbors subdivide their land and sell it to people who want to build homes. Some of these local ordinances include restrictive covenants that allow towns and counties to place conditions on zoning permits for property in specific neighborhoods.

q1.translation: 为了帮助阻止将农田转变为社区、企业和垃圾填埋场，美国一些州通过了法律，如果土地所有者不将其用于建造房屋、办公园区、购物中心、工业综合体和其他建筑，就给土地所有者更高的价格。这些新规定被称为农业租金控制，也被称为农田保护计划。
q1.front: To help stop the conversion of farmland into neighborhoods, businesses, and landfills, some states in the United States have passed laws that give land owners higher prices for their farmland if they do not use it to build houses, office parks, shopping centers, industrial complexes, and other buildings. The new rules are called agricultural rent control and are also known as farmland preservation programs.
q1.content: To help stop the conversion of ____ into neighborhoods, businesses, and landfills, some states in the United States have passed laws that ____ land owners higher prices for ____ farmland if they do not ____ it to build houses, office parks, ____ centers, industrial complexes, and ____ buildings. The new rules are ____ agricultural rent control and are also ____ as farmland preservation programs.

q2.translation: 为了帮助阻止将农田转变为社区、企业和垃圾填埋场，美国一些州通过了法律，如果土地所有者不将其用于建造房屋、办公园区、购物中心、工业综合体和其他建筑，就给土地所有者更高的价格。这些新规定被称为农业租金控制，也被称为农田保护计划。这些项目旨在通过提高农民出售土地的价格来创造更多的农田。许多农业社区还通过了当地法令，允许农民在邻居将他们的土地细分出售给想要盖房的人时享有优先权。其中一些地方法令包括限制性的契约，允许城镇和县对特定社区的财产的分区许可设置条件。
q2.front: To help stop the conversion of farmland into neighborhoods, businesses, and landfills, some states in the United States have passed laws that give land owners higher prices for their farmland if they do not use it to build houses, office parks, shopping centers, industrial complexes, and other buildings. The new rules are called agricultural rent control and are also known as farmland preservation programs.
q2.middle: These programs are intended to create more farmland by increasing the prices farmers receive for the land they sell.
q2.ending: Many farming communities have also adopted local ordinances that give farmers the right to have a preference when their neighbors subdivide their land and sell it to people who want to build homes. Some of these local ordinances include restrictive covenants that allow towns and counties to place conditions on zoning permits for property in specific neighborhoods.

options.sentence: These programs are intended to create more farmland by increasing the prices farmers receive for the land they sell.
Agricultural policy needs to consider both the public good, such as food safety and nutritional standards, and the private good for farmers.
The value of a farm, or of any business enterprise, depends on the factors that affect its production and sale.
Although agricultural productivity has increased over the past century, production costs have risen by nearly 80 percent.

options.sentence: Critics argue that farm subsidies are unfair because they encourage overproduction and overpaying for crops not deemed to be worth the sale price.
This results in marginal farmland being used mainly for cultivation of low-value crops, which improves yields and quality of agricultural products.
Local ordinances in farming communities may include restrictive covenants that allow towns and counties to place conditions on zoning permits for property in specific neighborhoods.
Such cultivation of marginal land improves yield and quality of agricultural products, so there is little incentive to grow high-value crops on the land.
